meanings.definition: A system of government in which one person has absolute power.
meanings.sent1: In autocracies, the leader makes all the decisions without asking anyone else.
meanings.sent2: Many people in history have suffered under autocracies where their rights were taken away.
meanings.sent3: The autocracies in fairy tales always have a cruel king or queen ruling over the land.
meanings.sent4: The autocracies of the past crumbled under the weight of their own corruption and tyranny.
meanings.sent5: Living under autocracies feels like being trapped in a cage with no way out.

meanings.definition: The rule or power of an autocrat.
meanings.sent1: The autocracies of ancient empires were often characterized by the whims of the rulers.
meanings.sent2: The autocracies of today rely on fear and control to maintain their power.
meanings.sent3: It's hard to imagine a world where autocracies are replaced by fair and just governments.
meanings.sent4: The autocracies of the past loom over us like dark shadows, reminding us of the dangers of unchecked power.
meanings.sent5: The autocracies of history serve as cautionary tales of what happens when power is concentrated in the hands of a few.

meanings.definition: The principles or practices of autocrats.
meanings.sent1: The autocracies of oppressive regimes suppress freedom of speech and dissent.
meanings.sent2: Studying the autocracies of the past helps us understand the patterns of authoritarian rule.
meanings.sent3: Some people are drawn to the autocracies of power, seeking control over others.
meanings.sent4: The autocracies of corrupt leaders poison the well of democracy and freedom.
meanings.sent5: The autocracies of dictators are built on the backs of those they oppress.
